entry.title: Trimble TSC5
entry.summary: Hello all, Our company bought 2 TSC5 about a month ago. They are a big step up from the TSC3 we were using. But it only took around a month for the screen to fall out of one of them. Has anyone else had this happen?

entry.title: Free Resume Generator for Land Surveyors
entry.summary:
https://landsurveyorsunited.com/cv Editing Your CV Resume This is a sample resume set up just for land surveyors. This will come in handy in a pinch. Click any field to edit/ replace existing dummy content. Use Tab key to go to next input box. You can add/remove any element you like. Also pay attention to the page break. Press CTRL+P to save as PDF! Here is a short video for how to use the tool. Also pay attention to the page break. Press CTRL+P to save as PDF! Once you save your PDF to your computer, use the code provided below to embed your resume into your profile. Embed the PDF into your Community Profile for employers and recruiters to see. Upload photos and start discussions which demonstrate your experience in land surveying, whichwill attract recruiters to your profile, thus having access to your credentials and Resume for hiring considerations. Get creative... reverse the job search by adding yourself as a reverse job post on the Jobs Board.
Find the box/tab inside your profile and copy/paste the following code into your editable HTML box. Then upload your PDF file and replace the section with your URL like I did in the tutorial.

entry.title: New Emlid Videos from E38 Survey Solutions
entry.summary: Hi Everyone! We added (and will continue to add) a few new videos to our YouTube channel including How to Connect the Emlid RS2 to ReachView 3 and Carlson SurvPC/CE. We'll add more videos throughout the month of June so if you've been curious about the RS2 and how it will work with different software, check out our videos. Additionally, we'll be holding another Getting Started With the RS2 this coming Wednesday at 10AM EST. Sign up for a spot here. Thanks!

entry.title: Surveyor Compass
entry.summary: Compass surveying is a type of surveying in which the directions of surveying lines are determined with a magnetic compass, and the length of the surveying lines are measured with a tape or chain or laser range finder. The compass is generally used to run a traverse line. Survey Compass Pictured Courtesy of Compass Museum What is a Survey Compass? A Survey Compass, otherwise known as Circumferentor, is an instrument used in surveying to measure horizontal angles. It was superseded by the theodolite in the early 19th century. A circumferentor consists of a circular brass box containing a magnetic needle, which moves freely over a brass circle, or compass divided into 360 degrees. The needle is protected by a glass covering. A pair of sights is located on the North-South axis of the compass.…

entry.title: Looking to Hire a Field Surveyor / Survey Technician
entry.summary:
Surveyor Duties & Responsibilities The job duties that surveyors should expect to have can be diverse and require various training and skills. (Some listed below are required but not all all necessary).
Conduct physical site surveys using a variety of equipment and tools. Prepare sketches and notes, and perform electronic data collection. Coordinate field staff and process field data. Verify the accuracy of survey data, including measurements and calculations conducted at survey sites. Calculate areas of land parcels and easements using mathematics and computer software. Research previous survey evidence, including maps, deeds, physical evidence, and other records to obtain data needed for surveys. Prepare site surveying documents and present findings to clients. Office surveyor and field technician who can work remotely Work on Contract basis
Please contact Thomas at 310-666-2510 if you are interested or thomas@terwilligerLSE.com
